metadata.title: CVE-2021-22945 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
When sending data to an MQTT server, libcurl <= 7.73.0 and 7.78.0 could insome circumstances erroneously keep a pointer to an already freed memoryarea and both use that again in a subsequent call to send data and alsofree it *again*.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-22945` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

curl - 7.68.0-1ubuntu2.6
libcurl3-gnutls - 7.68.0-1ubuntu2.6
libcurl3-nss - 7.68.0-1ubuntu2.6
libcurl4 - 7.68.0-1ubuntu2.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: curl package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.68.0-1ubuntu2.6').
